description:
Gorou is a gynecologist and idol fan who’s in shock after his favorite star, Ai, announces an impromptu hiatus. Little does Gorou realize that he’s about to forge a bond with her that defies all common sense! Lies are an idol’s weapon!

(Source: Yen Press)

Notes:
- Nominated for the 14th and 15th Manga Taisho.
- Nominated for the 26th Tezuka Osamu Cultural Prize.
- Nominated for the 67th Shogakukan Manga Award in the general category.
- Nominated for the 46th Kodansha Manga Award.
- Winner of the 7th Next Manga Award in the print category.
- Chapter count includes 2 extra chapters.
synonyms: [เกิดใหม่เป็นลูกโอชิ]
OSHI NO KO - DƯỚI ÁNH HÀO QUANG
Oshi no Ko: Minha Estrela Preferida

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Educational
tags.description: Primary aim is to educate the audience.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Denpa
tags.description: Works that feature themes of social dissociation, delusions, and other issues like suicide, bullying, self-isolation, paranoia, and technological necessity in daily lives. Classic iconography: telephone poles, rooftops, and trains.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Pregnancy
tags.description: Features pregnant female characters or discusses the topic of pregnancy.

tags.name: Filmmaking
tags.description: Centers around the art of filmmaking.

tags.name: VTuber
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is either an actual or fictive VTuber.

tags.name: Cosplay
tags.description: Features dressing up as a different character or profession.

tags.name: Incest
tags.description: Features sexual or romantic relations between characters who are related by blood.

title.native: かぐや様は告らせたい～天才たちの恋愛頭脳戦～
【推しの子】～二人のエチュード～

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/akasaka_aka) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=3127667)

Illustrator for Vocaloid's [IA](https://anilist.co/character/187466/IA) and ONE. Aka Akasaka got his start as an assistant to [Jinsei Kataoka](https://anilist.co/staff/97888/Jinsei-Kataoka) and [Kazuma Kondou](https://anilist.co/staff/97887/Kazuma-Kondou), the creators of Deadman Wonderland. His first serialized manga was an adaptation of the light novel series Sayonara Piano Sonata, published by Kadokawa in 2011. Kaguya-sama: Love Is War began serialization in Miracle Jump in 2015 but was later moved to Weekly Young Jump in 2016 due to its popularity.

In a Tweet on November 3, 2022, he announced his retirement from drawing manga. He will continue to work on authoring his current/future works.

__Favorite WSJ Manga:__ Chainsaw-man, Boku no Hero Academia, Agravity Boys, Jujutsu Kaisen

Mengo Yokoyari dropped out of high school to become a mangaka assistant. She had wanted to become a manga artist since she was little.

Yokoyari made her debut in 2009 with Maken☆H Zemi!, which was published in Magazine WOoooo! and later collected as part of the Mokkai Shiyo? compilation.

After contributing regularly to the magazine, she was invited by a Futabasha editor to draw a series for one its magazines. It would materialize as Haruwaka, Yokoyari's first serialization work.

She married someone from outside the manga industry on February 22, 2019.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yorimen) | [Pìxiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/75189) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yorip) | [Twitter (Her cat's twitter account)](https://twitter.com/ruttan627)
Nesrine Mezouane is a Japanese to French translator specialized in Manga and Japanese Pop-culture related materials. She currently resides in Versailles, France.

[Official Site](https://www.san-g.fr/a-propos) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/marredetre1fille/?hl=fr)

San-G is a French Graphic Designer specialized in book designing and lettering.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/shininyan) | [Blog](https://blog.kouhi.me/) | [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/shininyan)

She is a Japanese to English translator,  r/FFXIV mod and VTuber 椎名雨音(Shiina Amane).

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/annamaria.puto.1)

Graduate of Japanese studies at the Adam Mickiewicz University in Poznań. Involved in the scientific circle Japonica Creativa.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Goldengreg?t=_YzyvIDSeaDwjKpO6tds2Q&s=09)

Grégoire Hellot is the CEO of Kurokawa Editions.

[Linkedin](https://www.linkedin.com/in/abigail-blackman) | [Twitter](https://x.com/dydreemblvr) | [Etsy](https://www.etsy.com/shop/dydreemblvr/?etsrc=sdt)

Thriving on doing a bit of everything, Abigail has been working in the US manga industry since 2008. Since leaving her in-house editorial role in 2013, Abigail has undertaken a wide range of freelance assignments including editing and localizing translated scripts; lettering and retouching for manga interiors; and designing promotional items, ads, and cover logos.
When she isn't panels-deep in a new manga project, Abigail enjoys various other creative pursuits, as well as generally being out of doors.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/uszksr) Scouted by an editor from Shueisha and author Tatsuya Matsuki for her Samon the Summoner fan art, she moved from Kansai to Tokyo in order to start her career. She partnered up with Matsuki to publish the one-shot Welcome to the Asagaya Art Academy's Film Program, which became the basis for the serialization of ACT-AGE.
